reviews.text: The fridge & microwave is a must for me when traveling. The hotel was clean and that is another absolute must for me. The price was reasonable. An overall good experience.
reviews.title: Will stay here again!

reviews.text: This hotel was very nice and great for the price. They actually upgraded their rooms with duvet and full hot dulex breakfast and 4 different menu each day. This was great because my family enjoyed having different items to eat each day. We stay here all the time on our way to florida and back home ohio. thank you for all the friendly staffs as well.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I checked into this place and I really liked it. It was away from Knoxville traffic, pretty nice in and out, and it was only $62 on priceline. I was very happy with the size of my room and bathroom, the cleanliness, amount/location of outlets, and amenities provided. Staff seemed friendly, and the place wasn't crowded at all, maybe about 10 total people staying here.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Until Morning

reviews.text: One of the rare times when I did not get to try out the fitness center. I got to see it, several cardio machines, no weights or strength equipment though. There is a pool and hot tub available, but I didn't use those either.There's lots of places to get gas/food around too, and its right off of i-75. I was very busy the night I checked in working on reports and proposals, and intended to print them in the business center on the way out in the AM.
reviews.title: Great family stay

reviews.text: Morning came around and breakfast wasn't too bad. Potatoes,premade egg/cheese patties, oatmeal, cereal, waffles, breads. Good coffee. I was in a rush to get to an early meeting and I had seen in the hotel info book that there was a business center so I headed there with my flash drive to print my documents.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms...comfortable beds

reviews.text: We stayed there for 5 nights last week and enjoyed our stay very much. Their breakfast was good mostly sausage patties during the week but there was omelets on Sunday and French toast on Saturday and there is a waffle maker daily. The rooms are nice and fresh looking and clean. Only issue is that the accessible rooms do not have any storage at all none zilch you must put your stuff on the floor (?) My friends in a regular room had a little wall alcove-like shelving system that looked wonderful. Ours did have a towel rack tho which was nice but no counter space or shelves at all for toiletries. The pool was nice and we did not get any rash as per previous long ago reviews. Pantene brand shampoo etc. Wendys is right outside
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: The 1 bedroom suite was large and had 2 full baths. It has a king size bed in BR and pull-out couch in living room, so would be great for family. Only issue is that there is no door to close between BR and LR. Nice large chairs and couch--good for visiting. It was clean and has interior hallway entry. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Breakfast is offered daily and had a nice variety - both hot and cold.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and people

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying here April 3 for 5 nights while visiting family in Loudon. I am a travel agent and have stayed in many hotels over the years. I was very impressed with how clean and well maintained the property is kept. The staff were always very friendly and helpful and housekeeping did a great job in keeping our room clean. The breakfast was an added bonus. I will be returning to Loudon and will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Nice, Family Hotel w/ Indoor Pool! The service is always great and the pool area is really nice. The breakfast is a nice addition but maybe not the most flavorful. They keep fresh brewed coffee & freshly-baked cookies on hand all hours. =) The rooms are nice enough with the family suite having two baths which makes getting up & out a lot easier with a brood of children. The only real con is the luke-warm bath water. Have stayed there twice...months apart...and exactly the same room and the water temp was the same. =(
reviews.title: Nice, Family Hotel w/ Indoor Pool!

reviews.text: this hotel was amazing for the price that i paid. it was equally as nice as any holiday inn express that i have ever stayed in. The rooms were very nice and clean. the pool was great if i would have been there with my family. the breakfast was also great. it featured both hot and cold items. there were quick fast food restaurants near by as well as a gas station. I will most certainly be staying here again!
reviews.title: Impressive!

reviews.text: I commute back and forth from Ohio to Florida and back 4x's a year. This is always my first overnight stop heading south and my last heading north. Great breakfast,comfy beds and very clean! I find I can always trust Carlson hotels.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed in this hotel in August on our way to New Orleans. The staff was so friendly and the check-in was a breeze. We had a 2 room Queen suite that had 2 bathrooms. The rooms were so large and super clean. There was a mini fridge in each room and a microwave and coffee maker in one room. The room was far enough off the interstate that you did not hear the traffic. The breakfast was more than adequate with many choices. The kids loved the pool which was also very clean. I hope we get the occasion to stay at this hotel again because we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: rooms were clean. pool was indoors. whirlpool was nice. breakfast was average.
reviews.title: clean rooms
Thank god they were next door!
reviews.text: After a HORRIBLE experience at the Super 8 next door, we walked next door to this hotel and the woman on duty was absolutely wonderful. We explained what had happened and she did everything she could to get her the best price possible for our stay. The amenities are great, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. They have laundry machines on each floor. It's a little more money, but WELL worth it.

reviews.title: Clerk accused me of trying to sneak in an extra person.
reviews.text: The clerk on duty on June 18th at approximately 7 p.m. accused me of hiding an adult in the back of my van and was adamant that I get a suite for 3 adults and one 14 yoa child. She claimed the fire code required me to get a suite which cost about $25 more than a room with 2 queen beds. I asked her to please go look in my van and she would see that there were only 3 adults and one child and she just kept insisting my party required a suite. When I asked her for her bosses email so I could notify the owner that her clerk had cost her a customer, she claimed she did not know her bosses email. She then also threatened to call the police on me, which I welcomed since they could count the number of people in my van. I let her know that I did not believe she did not know her bosses email and left. I stayed next door at the Super 8 which was not as upscale but they claimed the fire code for 3 adults and 1 child would not require a suite. Thanks but no thanks Country Inn & Suites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff...Sabrina had a wonderful smile and we were warmly greeted by her. The room with a King bed was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable . Even the hot tub was not your typical tepid water ...perfectly hot.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was extremely clean and welcoming as was the room. Breakfast was typical fare buit met our expectations.. Kudos to this property
reviews.title: Difficult to check in, Rooms was a little dated, Could have been cleaner

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here while on a small weekend roadtrip to the NC/TN mountains. We used point+cash in order to book a standard room (only option online).
reviews.title: Big bug in the middle of the night

reviews.text: Staff: The lady at the front desk was very nice and helpful. I asked if there were any whirlpool rooms available and she said there were but I was booked in a standard room. I asked if I could pay to upgrade to one. She said I could, but had a lot of difficulty in calculating/imputing into the computer. But that seemed like a system problem - it was over-complicated because of my points+cash booking.
reviews.title: Great place to stop for a d ay or a week.

reviews.text: Room: The room was a little bit dated. Could use some newer furnishings/carpeting. Although it was dated, the room was clean enough. Sometimes an older room, no matter how clean, can just show some age that you may initially see as unclean. But the suite was pretty clean. The bathroom was clean, the whirlpool was nice, but it took about 30 minutes to fill up the tub as it basically uses a standard sink faucet. The bed was standard Country Inn, relatively comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
